notes: Students with senior standing required to take three MECE 5000-level courses OR two MECE 5000-level + one non-MECE 3000+ level from engineering/math/science

courses.name: Machine Design
courses.description: General mechanical design considerations, materials, stress analysis, deflection, statistical analysis, static and variable loading failures

courses.name: Finite Element Analysis
courses.description: Application of finite element methods to mechanical engineering problems

courses.name: Vibrations
courses.description: Theory of vibrations, modeling and analysis of mechanical systems

courses.name: Intermediate Fluid Mechanics
courses.description: Advanced fluid mechanics topics and applications

courses.name: Computational Fluid Dynamics
courses.description: Numerical methods for fluid flow simulation

courses.name: Internal Combustion Engines
courses.description: Thermodynamic cycles, combustion, and engine performance

courses.name: Advanced Heat Transfer
courses.description: Advanced conduction, convection, and radiation heat transfer

courses.name: Robotics and Automation
courses.description: Robot kinematics, dynamics, and control systems

courses.name: Mechatronics
courses.description: Integration of mechanical, electrical, and computer systems
